alert.note: Alert for Big Island East; Big Island North; Kauai North; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Leeward West; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Olomana; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 29 at 3:55PM HST until December 30 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND EAST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI MAUI AND THE BIG ISLAND... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR EAST AND WEST FACING SHORES EXPOSED TO THE NORTH SWELL... .Large north (010-020 deg) and northwest (320 deg) swells are combining to produce advisory level surf for north facing shores. The north swell has become dominant, allowed surf heights to lower for west facing shores and increase for exposed east facing shores through Saturday. The swell will slowly lower through Saturday evening, before a new large northwest swell fills in Saturday night. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Surf 14 to 18 feet along north facing shores of most islands. Surf 8 to 12 feet along east and west facing shores of Molokai and Maui, as well as east facing shores of the Big Island. * WHERE...North facing shores of Niihau, Oahu, Molokai, Maui, and the Big Island, as well as west facing shores of Molokai and Maui. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
